root.name: append()

example.code: JSONArray json def setup(): json = JSONArray() json.append(32) json.append(1.5) json.append("grape") json.append(True) JSONobj = JSONObject() obj.setFloat("persistence", 0.75) json.append(obj) JSONArray arr = JSONArray() arr.append("red") arr.append("green") arr.append("blue") json.append(arr) println(json) # Sketch prints: # [ # 32, # 1.5, # "grape", # True, # "persistence": 0.75, # [ # "red", # "green", # "blue" # ] # ]

root.description: Appends a new value to the JSONArray, increasing the array's length by one. New values may be of the following types: int, float, String, boolean, JSONObject, or JSONArray.
